White_Plains.Hawthorne Circle: Hawthorne Circle was a notably dangerous traffic circle located in Hawthorne, New York, United States until 1971 when it was replaced with a three-level interchange. The circle once connected two busy highways, the Taconic State Parkway and the Saw Mill River Parkway. It also accessed to the Bronx River Parkway by way a 2.6-mile (4.18 km) segment of the Taconic Parkway.
